chunks.en: Everyone, have you returned?
This new year ended so quickly again ğŸ¤¦â€â™‚ï¸
I can't wait to leave. Besides disliking me every day, what else can my family do?
@shmilypeter My friend, you should come to my house for the new year.
I'm not being sarcastic. My parents just can't stand seeing anyone idle.
If you're idle, they'll find ways to prove you're lazy and start criticizing you.
At the same time, my work income, while not top-notch, is still about three times the local average, but they can hardly give me any help in terms of economy or work relationships.
So I can't figure out, if I'm really as lazy as they say, did this job and the year-end evaluations just fall from the sky?
This is a typical situation where they only focus on your shortcomings and don't see your strengths, and in many ways, they themselves can't do as well.
Home should be a haven, not a school for re-education.
Family members should pretend to be confused sometimes. If there are no major issues of principle involving illegal or unethical behavior, just turn a blind eye.
Creating a tense atmosphere at home every day, and not being able to express your own thoughts, of course I want to leave sooner and preferably not come back.
@Frytea #21 @Livid Spam, recent comments are all

No, on a road trip.
Waiting in line for ticket check.
It's really too fast ğŸ˜­
In Shenzhen, just got off the plane.
Not yet, still a few days.
@volvo007 Having different ideas with parents is really tormenting.
Still have two days to rest.
@volvo007 #7 For someone like me who lives at home all year round, the most important thing is to have a good relationship with my parents.
Going back the week after next, let the kids play in the countryside for a few more days.
Took 4 days off, back to work on the 10th.
Didn't get a ticket.
Returning on February 4th.
Low-end migrant worker staying in the city, no need to return.
